comments.body: it is the script that format all python code automatically. It is not used _yet_. Executing it creates a big bang change, so I will only partial changes it implies. Only I'd like to have the agreement that the code style that will be enforced it ok for everyone.

@davies what do you think about including this vs just enforcing the checks? If it would be used, I'm for it, but not clear how often this would be run in practice by anyone if we're not going to use its big-bang changes.

My point of view:
- don't enforce it right away, just agree on the style
- execute manualy on some files (in my next PR, it's on documentation), and on small big bang PRs
- then enforce automatic formatting (preferably with Yapf) on some files. On Buildbot we use a git commit hook to check python files automatically, apply some pep8 formatting, execute pylint,...
